p: The European Center for Disease Prevention and Control (ECDC) defines ILI as the sudden onset of symptoms and at least one of following four systemic symptoms: fever or feverishness, malaise, headache, and myalgia, and at least one of the following three respiratory symptoms: cough, sore throat, and shortness of breath. ARI is defined as sudden symptom onset with at least one of the following four respiratory symptoms: cough, sore throat, shortness of breath, coryza, and the clinicianâ€™s judgement that the illness is due to an infection [ 8].
